jvelociter - (20/05/2009 11:03): anamarias CristinaS Hi SOCers from Bucaresti :)  
jvelociter - (20/05/2009 11:04): we'll be a delegation from the XWiki Iasi office at eLiberatica this week-end  
CristinaS - (20/05/2009 11:04): hi!   
arunreddy - (20/05/2009 11:04): jvelociter :Hi  
CristinaS - (20/05/2009 11:04): we will be there :)  
jvelociter - (20/05/2009 11:04): cool!  
arunreddy - (20/05/2009 11:05): Missing :)  
jvelociter - (20/05/2009 11:05): we'll meet by there then  
CristinaS - (20/05/2009 11:05): who will come from Iasi?  
CristinaS - (20/05/2009 11:05): yes , we can't wait :)  
anamarias - (20/05/2009 11:06): hi jvelociter   
jvelociter - (20/05/2009 11:06): I will come (I'll give a talk about application wikis), evalica and eduard (enygma) will be there too  
jvelociter - (20/05/2009 11:06): and lucaa is going to come as well (I think)  
anamarias - (20/05/2009 11:07): cool :)  
jvelociter - (20/05/2009 11:07): so that will be 4 from Iasi + you two = 6 XWikiers  
CristinaS - (20/05/2009 11:07): nice :)  
jvelociter - (20/05/2009 11:09): I'll prepare a demo of my latest play with Bespin in XWiki as well, since there will be mozilla folks over there

tachirei - (20/05/2009 16:06): florinciu: shouldn't IXWikiClient have a LogOff() method?  
florinciu - (20/05/2009 16:08): yes, it should. But I don't see it as a priority. It's easy to implement it but i never took the time.  
tachirei - (20/05/2009 16:09): it would be necessary when user is switching XWiki server,changing login settings or  when XWord gets a 401 Unauthorized error  
tachirei - (20/05/2009 16:09): is it ok if I implement it?  
florinciu - (20/05/2009 16:09): ok

arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:26): vmassol : Hi  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:26): few doubts  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:26): arunreddy\_: hi  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:26): Does platform/trunks/core/xwiki-rendering/xwiki-rendering-parsers/xwiki-rendering-parser-wikimodel  includes all the necessary api to Parse various wikis to standard XDOM ?  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:27): apis are in xwiki-rendering-api  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:27): the module you mention contains some wiki parsers  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:27): namely: XWiki 2.0, mediawiki, confluence, creole, xhtml  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:28): (maybe some others)  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:28): they implement the Parser api in xwiki-rendering-api  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:28): and the Parser.parse() method indeed returns a XDOM  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:29): Which part is responsible to convert Input Syntax to XDOM   
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:29): the parser  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:29): here's a doc explaining this:  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:29): http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Modules/RenderingModule  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:30): Is it xwiki-rendering-parser-wikimodel or the xwiki-rendering-Api   
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:30): Yeah i have been through the doc completely.  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:31): Am trying to understand hows its implemented.. so that i will get a clear picture  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:32): One more doubt.... Does MediaWiki Parser support sql dumps ?  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:33): I mean, MediaWiki can be exported in two ways -- SQL and XML dumps..  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:34): The existing one in XWiki Rendering Module  
tuska left at 19:37 ("Ex-Chat")  
jvdrean left at 19:38 ()  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:39): "Is it xwiki-rendering-parser-wikimodel or the xwiki-rendering-Api "  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:39): I have no idea what you mean  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:39): it = ?  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:39): have it not answred above?  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:39): s/it/I/  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:39): " Does MediaWiki Parser support sql dumps ?"  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:40): I have no idea you need to research it  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:40): not sure what this means btw  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:40): "The existing one in XWiki Rendering Module"  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:40): one = ?  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:40): (arunreddy\_)  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:40): the first one is clear.  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:41): if you're asking whether the rendernig module supports importing wiki content  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:41): then the answer is no  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:41): that's why there's this GSOC project ;)  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:42): Am speaking about WikiModelMediaWikiParser in side the xwiki-rendering-parser-wikimodel  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:42): what's the question?  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:42): "The existing one in XWiki Rendering Module" is hardly a question ;)  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:42): The WikiModel Media Wiki parser supports import as SQL or not.  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:42): no where it is documented  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:43): "Parser: Parses some textual input in a given syntax and generate a XDOM object which is an AST representing the input into structured blocks."  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:43): so the XWiki MEdiaWiki Parser parses some mediawiki syntax in text form  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:43): and gneerate a XDOM  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:44): from http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Modules/RenderingModule  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:45): ok, Thanks  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:45): arunreddy\_: if you need detail on wikimodel you can go here:  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:46): http://www.google.fr/url?sa=t&source=web&ct=res&cd=1&url=http%3A%2F%2Fcode.google.com%2Fp%2Fwikimodel%2F&ei=1EEUSp2fFtOZjAeA2ei6BA&usg=AFQjCNHAFIEIWPKcTuuXtcP-k74NdRSHgw&sig2=IAkJI1GAhreFHXCyH7Gi\_A  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:46): oops  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:46): http://code.google.com/p/wikimodel/  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:48): Already looked into it. Sad that it doesnt have good documentation on whats going on. I have to research more into it  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:48): :)  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:49): arunreddy\_: the code is quite clear  
vmassol - (20/05/2009 19:49): but you shouldn't need to look at it  
CristinaS left at 19:51 ("Leaving")  
arunreddy\_ - (20/05/2009 19:52): Oh ,ok
